description: herald +‎ -ry. First attested in 1572. Displaced earlier heraldy, from herald +‎ -y.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The profession or art of devising, granting and blazoning coats of arms, tracing genealogies and ruling on questions of protocol or rank.
examples: Rouge Dragon Pursuivant is a specialist in heraldry at the College of Arms.

entries.meaning: (countable) An armorial ensign along with its history and description.

examples: Onlookers were impressed by the rich and colorful heraldry.
